meanings.definition: To swallow greedily or in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: The hungry dog would ingurgitate his food as if he hadn't eaten in days.
meanings.sent2: After the long hike, the tired hiker would ingurgitate the refreshing water from the stream.
meanings.sent3: The child pretended to ingurgitate all the imaginary cookies at the tea party.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner seemed to ingurgitate all the dust and dirt from the carpet in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to ingurgitate the heavy rain, swelling its banks.

meanings.sent1: The competitive eater would ingurgitate hot dogs at an astonishing speed.
meanings.sent2: The bear would ingurgitate the berries in the forest before hibernation.
meanings.sent3: The movie character would ingurgitate popcorn during the exciting scenes.
meanings.sent4: The bookworm would ingurgitate novels, finishing one after another.
meanings.sent5: The toddler would ingurgitate the colorful candies at the birthday party.

meanings.definition: To drink excessively or to excess.
meanings.sent1: At the party, he would ingurgitate soda until he felt sick.
meanings.sent2: The camel would ingurgitate water before crossing the desert.
meanings.sent3: The student would ingurgitate energy drinks during exam week.
meanings.sent4: The athlete would ingurgitate sports drinks to stay hydrated during the game.
meanings.sent5: The bird would ingurgitate nectar from the flowers in the garden.
